turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Queen Victoria Hospital.
turn.1: What was the Queen Victoria Hospital?
turn.2: Queen Victoria Hospital The Queen Victoria Hospital (QVH), located in East Grinstead, West Sussex, England is the specialist reconstructive surgery centre for the south east of England, and also provides services at clinics across the region.
turn.3: What kind of surgeries did they do?
turn.4: It has become world-famous for its pioneering burns and plastic surgery.
turn.5: Why was it called Queen Victoria?
turn.6: The hospital was named after Queen Victoria.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: It is managed by the Queen Victoria Hospital NHS Foundation Trust.
turn.10: Founded as East Grinstead Cottage Hospital in 1863, the hospital adopted the name, "Queen Victoria Hospital", in the 1930s and moved to its present site in 1936.
turn.11: What other surgeries did they do?
turn.12: During the Second World War, it developed as a specialist burns unit under the leadership of Sir Archibald McIndoe, and became world-famous for pioneering treatment of RAF and allied aircrew who were badly burned or crushed and required reconstructive plastic surgery.
